ygData.subject: RE: Cleric's and PvP
ygData.msgSnippet: not on a PvP server it would not....it would be part of the norm to start off a fight....if they did suspend for this....that would be a SERIOUS problem. On a
ygData.messageBody:
not on a PvP server it would not....it would be part of the norm to start
off a fight....if they did suspend for this....that would be a SERIOUS
problem.

On a PVP mud i played....(pvp areas were set up witrh great exp, but dangers
of looting corpses) if you wanted to hit someone first thing you did was
get all spell casters to dispel magic. typical thing to do I would
say...yeah, i want to hit the druid with a dam shield on...

Bann

-----Original Message-----
From: Chris Wheeler [mailto:wheelech@...]
Sent: Monday, August 23, 1999 3:43 PM
To: 'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Cleric's and PvP


From: Chris Wheeler <wheelech@...>

I have heard (haven't tried, not high enough level) that a nasty tactic that
clerics can employ is to use Cancel Magic to remove buffs from other
players.

Warning though, I believe this can result in bad things happening in terms
of having your account suspended. It may fall under the same category as
training MOBs onto players on purpose.

-----Original Message-----
From: Chas Watkins [mailto:cwatkins@...]
Sent: 1999/08/23 3:34 PM
To: 'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Cleric's and PvP


From: Chas Watkins <cwatkins@...>

Though it may be exploited it would be great to be able to buff an heal
mobs. Players should be able to align themselves with MOB's. In Crushbone on
Rallos, we often have DE's defending it from High Elves etc. They should be
able to align themselves with them, heal and buff them, and trade (?) with
them.

Just a thought.


PS still going to try and heal MOB's tonight. I'm almost sure in now that I
have done it by accident in the past too.

Regards

Nynenom

-----Original Message-----
From: Chris Wheeler [mailto:wheelech@...]
Sent: Monday, August 23, 1999 12:08 PM
To: 'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Cleric's and PvP


From: Chris Wheeler <wheelech@...>

I suspected as such. As I said, I was able to do this a while back, and it
was only by accident that I would hit the heal hotkey during a fight.

Oh well, I guess I just have to wait for cancel magic to wreak havoc on the
dark elves :)

-----Original Message-----
From: Mr. J Daniels [mailto:warpig@...]
Sent: 1999/08/23 3:05 PM
To: 'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Cleric's and PvP


From: "Mr. J Daniels" <warpig@...>

You cant heal mobs even if they are fighting you. (Unless that has
changed recently)

Mr. J Daniels


On Mon, 23 Aug 1999, Chas Watkins wrote:

> From: Chas Watkins <cwatkins@...>
>
> How interesting. A high level Cleric could wreck havoc. All he has to do
> watch a player fight a MOB. Make a token swipe at the MOB. Then stand back
> and Heal it till it kills the player or chases him off the Zone.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Chris Wheeler [mailto:wheelech@...]
> Sent: Monday, August 23, 1999 11:51 AM
> To: 'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Cleric's and PvP
>
>
> From: Chris Wheeler <wheelech@...>
>
> I play a cleric on The Rathe. I have experimented with healing MOBs, and
as
> far as I can tell , the answer is no. Same goes for buffs. That is, if
you
> mean to buff them while they are fighting other players. If they are
> fighting you, I think you can heal them, as I have done this accidentally
in
> the past. I haven't done it recently, so I can't be 100% certain. Though
I
> do seem to recall seeing the MOB's life bar inch back up after an
accidental
> heal on my behalf.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Chas Watkins [mailto:cwatkins@...]
> Sent: 1999/08/23 2:41 PM
> To: 'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com'
> Subject: [EQ-Clerics] Cleric's and PvP
>
>
> From: Chas Watkins <cwatkins@...>
>
> Has anyone tried healing or buffing a NPC or a MOB. I play a Cleric on
> Rallos Zek (PvP) and my main rationale is I like to heal. I play a "good"
> cleric and have healed bad/good races. My main irritation is when I'm
> suddenly PK'd by a member of my own race. (High Elf. I hang my head in
shame
> at my fallen brothers and sisters)
>
> Anyway normally there is a +/- 4 range for PvP correct? It seems to me
that
> the Cleric is uniquely positioned so that we can severely inconvenience
> other players far below our level. If they are fighting a MOB can we heal
> the MOB? Can we buff it? I must admit I have never tried it, I just
thought
> of it. Has anyone any experience of this??
>
> Regards
>
> Nynenom of Rallos Zek
>
